text: Thomas Lanier "Tennessee" Williams III (March 26, 1911 â€“ February 25, 1983) was an American writer, perhaps best known for his play A Streetcar Named Desire. He was of English, Welsh and Huguenot ancestry. He was gay. He was an alcoholic and drug addict who died of an accidental drug overdose. ==Other websites== *http://www.imagi-nation.com/moonstruck/clsc9.htm Category:1911 births Category:1983 deaths Category:American LGBT writers Category:American playwrights Category:Drug-related accidental deaths in the United States Category:Gay men Category:Writers from Mississippi
title: Tennessee Williams
